definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

to die/one's allocated lifespan is accomplished

sentences.english: Make-or-break week for GM as deadline nears .
sentences.chinese: 破产还是重组，通用汽车一周大限倒计时。

sentences.english: But how far can debt collectors legally go?
sentences.chinese: 但是追债人在法律范围内能做的多大限度呢？

sentences.english: How much upfront design should I tolerate?
sentences.chinese: 我该容忍多大限度的预先设计？

sentences.english: The election is really about whether the LDP’s time is up.
sentences.chinese: 此次大选的确关乎着是否自民党的大限已到。

sentences.english: How much up-front design do you tolerate?
sentences.chinese: 我该容忍多大限度的预先设计？

lunar apogee (point in the moon's orbit furthest from earth)/imaginary heavenly body occupying the second focus of the moon's elliptic orbit/dark moon/Lilith
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
